citation.article-title: Rudanella lutea gen. nov., sp. nov., isolated from an air sample in Korea.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Rudanella (Ru.da.nel′la. L.L. dim. suff. -ella; N.L. fem. dim. n. Rudanella arbitrary name, after RDA, Rural Development Administration, where taxonomic studies of this taxon were conducted).
Cells are strictly aerobic, Gram-negative, non-motile, non-spore-forming rods, frequently forming filaments.
Predominant cellular fatty acids are summed feature 3 (C16 : 1ω7c and/or iso-C15 : 0 2-OH), C16 : 1ω5c and iso-C15 : 0.
Major polar lipids are phosphatidylethanolamine and unknown aminolipids and polar lipids.
Phylogenetically, the genus belongs to the family Spirosomaceae within the phylum Bacteroidetes.
The type species is Rudanella lutea.
